interfaces
Interface Framework

All Known Implementing Classes:
FrameworkImpl
public interface Framework

Author:
Gautham Nagaraju, Prakhar Dubey, Victor Dong, Akash Kulkarni The framework sets up the whole cellular automata depending upon the rules setup by the client in the plugin. The framework takes care of initialising the grid and setting up the rules obtained from the plugin. After this, the framework generates the next state for each cell and displays this. It also provides options and features for the GUI so as to display the automata in interesting forms. The following interface, specifies all the methods associated with the framework

Method Summary
 void display(Framework f)
          The method generates the GUI for displaying the grid as the grid updates itself.
 void init()
          The method initialises the default grid, if the client doesn't provide a grid to initialise.
 void init(Grid g)
          The method initialises the grid using the grid supplied by the client and the default set of rules for the cellular automata.
 void nextGrid()
          The method generates the grid after one unit of time, thereby, updating all the cells to the next state.
 void run()
          The method starts a simulation that stops only when the client calls stop().
 void setColor(java.awt.Color[] c)
          The method sets the colours for the different states of each cell.
 void setRule(Rule r)
          The method sets the rules for determining what the next state for each cell will be.
 void simulate(int num)
          The method simulates the evolution of the automata through the given number of steps.
 void step(int num)
          The method generates the grid after num number of time steps.
 void stop()
          The method stops a running simulation.
 

Method Detail

init

void init()
The method initialises the default grid, if the client doesn't provide a grid to initialise.

Parameters:
Void -

init

void init(Grid g)
The method initialises the grid using the grid supplied by the client and the default set of rules for the cellular automata. Rules refers to the characteristics of a particular automata. By default the rules will refer to Convay's Game of Life.

Parameters:
g - the grid to initialise.

setRule

void setRule(Rule r)
The method sets the rules for determining what the next state for each cell will be.

Parameters:
r - the rules to use for determining the next state.

nextGrid

void nextGrid()
The method generates the grid after one unit of time, thereby, updating all the cells to the next state.

Parameters:
Void -

display

void display(Framework f)
The method generates the GUI for displaying the grid as the grid updates itself. It also provides the user a bunch of options in the GUI that enhance user interaction.

Parameters:
Void -

simulate

void simulate(int num)
The method simulates the evolution of the automata through the given number of steps.

Parameters:
num - the number of steps to simulate the automata.

step

void step(int num)
The method generates the grid after num number of time steps.

Parameters:
num - The number of time steps after which to generate the grid.

setColor

void setColor(java.awt.Color[] c)
The method sets the colours for the different states of each cell.

Parameters:
c - the array that specifies the colour for each step.

stop

void stop()
The method stops a running simulation.

Parameters:
Void -

run

void run()
The method starts a simulation that stops only when the client calls stop().

Parameters:
Void -
